conclusion: Need to analyze the p-V diagram and use the ideal gas law to find the temperature at state C.
State A has coordinates (1×10⁻³ m³, 3×10⁵ Pa), State B has coordinates (1×10⁻³ m³, 1×10⁵ Pa), State C has coordinates (3×10⁻³ m³, 1×10⁵ Pa).
Process AB is an isochoric process.
Use Charles's Law for process AB: p_A/T_A = p_B/T_B with T_A = 300 K.
Process BC is an isobaric process.
Use Gay-Lussac's Law for process BC: T_A/V_A = T_C/V_C.
The temperature of the gas at state C is 900 K.
